interactions:
Kayako - ticket id 60239472 // Jens Weber commented privately: Guten Morgen aus Frankfurt,
sieht gut aus.
Ich bin allerdings doch überrascht, dass der Fehler nicht schon früher entdeckt wurde.
Ist ja ein heftiger Bug, der auch die beiden anderen Installationen, die ich betreue, betrifft und ich gehe mal davon aus, das tausende Geräte in letzter Zeit nicht gepatched wurden. Ich hoffe sehr, das 12.14 nicht weitere heftige Fehler mitbringt.
Danke für Eure Unterstützung!
Jens

Kayako - ticket id 60239472 // Keyur Saxena commented publicly: Hello Jens,

Please apply this fix on all new and existing agents: Fixing the "You are no longer entitled to product updates" error in program updates for agents - GFI LanGuard [https://support.languard.gfi.com/article/128478-fixing-the-you-are-no-longer-entitled-to-product-updates-error-in-program-updates-for-agents]

Scan again after the fix to see if this is resolved, if not, provide the agent logs for review: Providing Troubleshooter Logs from GFI LanGuard Agent - GFI LanGuard [https://support.languard.gfi.com/article/123171-providing-troubleshooter-logs-from-gfi-languard-agent]

Best regards,
Keyur Saxena
GFI - LanGuard Support Team

This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with "This ticket can be closed" or update the status to Completed in the portal. We will write to you again to remind you.

Kayako - ticket id 60239472 // ATLAS commented publicly: Dear Jens,

Thank you for your detailed update and for systematically working through the previous recommendations. From your report, after reinstalling LanGuard and addressing permission settings, you now see that scheduled scans are working for some machines, but others in the OU fail with the error "Patch-Management-Datenbank nicht verfügbar" (Patch Management Database not available).

This error specifically indicates that the agent(s) on those machines are unable to connect to the server's Patch Management Database, or the required files are missing/corrupted. Below you'll find focused steps to resolve this issue, leveraging the most relevant troubleshooting from our knowledge base:

1. Verify Patch Management Files on the Server
The LanGuard console server must have all necessary configuration and database files under the PatchManagement directory. Missing or corrupted XML files can trigger "Patch-Management-Datenbank nicht verfügbar" errors. 
Check the following path on your LanGuard server: 
C:\ProgramData\GFI\LanGuard 12\PatchManagement\ 
Look especially for splanguagessupported.xml and other XML database files. If any are missing, re-copy them from a fresh installation as you have done with other files, and then restart the GFI LanGuard services.

2. Confirm Agent Connectivity and Permissions
For each endpoint reporting this error, confirm the following:
- Agents have proper network reachability to the LanGuard server.
- Local firewalls or antivirus software are not blocking agent communication or access to PatchManagement files.
- The account running the agent has sufficient permissions to read from the PatchManagement directory.
As per the article Why is the Activity Monitor Not Showing Scheduled Scans and Remediation Results? [https://support.languard.gfi.com/article/122194], database connection issues can sometimes be due to a lack of sysadmin rights for the LanGuard service account in SQL Server.

3. Re-register Agent Management DLL
A corrupted or unregistered DLL can prevent access to patch management resources. Perform the following (on the LanGuard server):
- Close LanGuard and stop all related services via services.msc.
- Open a command prompt as Administrator.
- Run:
regsvr32 "C:\Program Files (x86)\GFI\LanGuard xx\agentmanagercom.dll"
(Replace 'xx' with your version number)
- Restart all LanGuard services and test again.
Refer to the article Scheduled Scans and Patch Deployments Not Running [https://support.languard.gfi.com/article/122473] for further detail.

4. Agent Reinstallation
If certain machines consistently fail, the issue may be with a corrupted agent installation. For these PCs:
- Uninstall the GFI LanGuard Agent.
- Reboot the endpoint.
- Redeploy the agent from the LanGuard console.
See Why are LanGuard Agents Scans Not Starting? [https://support.languard.gfi.com/article/123154] for step-by-step details.

5. Additional Check: SQL Server Protocols
If agents or the server log files (such as lanss_vXXX_attendantservice.csv) show "importing scan" errors or database-related failures, ensure that the SQL instance has Shared Memory, Named Pipes, and TCP/IP all enabled in SQL Server Configuration Manager, as per Why are Agent scans stuck on "importing scan"? [https://support.languard.gfi.com/article/123153].

Summary of Actions:

 	* Verify all patch management XML/database files are present and correct.
 	* Confirm agent connectivity, required permissions, and no security software interference.
 	* Re-register agentmanagercom.dll if needed.
 	* For persistent endpoint issues, uninstall/reinstall the agent.
 	* If database access is suspected, check SQL protocols and service account roles.

If you observe the error persisting after these targeted steps, please also consult the referenced knowledge base articles for troubleshooting screenshots and detail:

 	* Why is the Activity Monitor Not Showing Scheduled Scans and Remediation Results? [https://support.languard.gfi.com/article/122194]
 	* Scheduled Scans and Patch Deployments Not Running [https://support.languard.gfi.com/article/122473]
 	* Why are LanGuard Agents Scans Not Starting? [https://support.languard.gfi.com/article/123154]
 	* Why are Agent scans stuck on "importing scan"? [https://support.languard.gfi.com/article/123153]

Once you complete these steps, your scheduled scans should cover all endpoints and the database connectivity error should be resolved.

Sincerely,
Atlas

Kayako - ticket id 60239472 // ATLAS commented publicly: Dear Jens,

Thank you for providing such a detailed description of the issue with scheduled scans in GFI LanGuard. I understand that after a full reinstall with a fresh SQL database, manual and time-based scans are working, but scheduled scans configured for OUs are not starting, and there is no related activity shown in the Activity Monitor.

This specific issue is often related to permission configurations or the account used to initiate scheduled scans. The following steps, combined from our most relevant knowledge base articles, should help resolve the problem:

1. Verify Permission Requirements:
Scheduled scans require the scanning account and the LNSSCommunicator module account to have certain Windows permissions:

 	* Replace a process level token right
 	* Logon as a batch job right

To check and assign these:

 	* Open the Local Security Policy editor (gpedit.msc or via Control Panel).
 	* Navigate to Computer Configuration > Windows Settings > Security Settings > Local Policies > User Rights Assignment.
 	* Find and open Replace a process level token.
Make sure the account used for scheduled scans and the LNSSCommunicator account are both listed. Add them if not.
 	* Do the same for Logon as a batch job.

For reference on determining which account is used for scheduled scans and the LNSSCommunicator, see the step-by-step section in our article Why is the Activity Monitor Not Showing Scheduled Scans and Remediation Results? [https://support.languard.gfi.com/article/122194].

2. Verify DCOM Identity for LNSSCommunicator:

 	* Run dcomcnfg, navigate to Computers > My Computer > DCOM Config > LNSSCommunicator.
 	* Check the Identity tab to see which account is being used. Ensure it matches the permissions you set above.

3. Service Account Permissions:
Ensure the LanGuard Attendant Service is running under the correct service account with the appropriate rights. If you provide alternate credentials within LanGuard, verify those meet the above requirements.

4. Network and Database Factors: 

 	* Verify that there are no name resolution or network connectivity issues between the server and clients (Why are few agents not scanning according to the schedule? [https://support.languard.gfi.com/article/123151]).
 	* Ensure sufficient free space and no SQL database limit issues exist (Maintaining the SQL Database Used by LanGuard [https://support.languard.gfi.com/article/123151]).

5. Additional Troubleshooting Steps:

 	* Double-check that antivirus or firewall solutions on both the server and clients are not interfering with LanGuard operations. Apply the recommended exclusions as detailed in our product documentation.
 	* If only the scheduled OU-based scans are affected, but manual and time-based scans work, focus on those permission steps as above. Consider redeploying the LanGuard Agent on a test client to rule out agent-side corruption, as described in Why are LanGuard Agents Scans Not Starting? [https://support.languard.gfi.com/article/123154].

After making these changes, schedule a scan and check if it now appears in the Activity Monitor. If you need the step-by-step walk-through for any of the above, the articles referenced provide detailed screenshots and further explanations:

 	* Why is the Activity Monitor Not Showing Scheduled Scans and Remediation Results? [https://support.languard.gfi.com/article/122194]
 	* Why are LanGuard Agents Scans Not Starting? [https://support.languard.gfi.com/article/123154]
 	* Why are few agents not scanning according to the schedule? [https://support.languard.gfi.com/article/123151]

If the scheduled scans still do not run after these steps, this may suggest a deeper configuration or environment-specific issue, but these steps cover the most common and relevant root causes found in similar environments.

Should you need further clarification regarding the permissions or specific settings seen in your environment, please refer to the linked knowledge base articles for more detailed guidance.

Sincerely,
Atlas
GFI - LanGuard Support Team.

-------------------------

Das Problem ist also sehr spezifisch: Die Agent-Aktivitätseinstellungen (die Scans, die die Agenten selbst zu den konfigurierten Zeiten ausführen sollen) werden nicht ausgelöst. Das deutet auf ein Problem mit der agentmanagercom.dll Registrierung hin oder auf korrupte Agent-Installationen. Lass uns das systematisch angehen: LÖSUNG 1: AGENTMANAGERCOM.DLL NEU REGISTRIEREN Dieses Modul ist verantwortlich für die Kommunikation zwischen Server und Agenten für geplante Aktionen. Wenn es nicht korrekt registriert ist, können Agent-gesteuerte Scans nicht starten. Schritte: * Schließe die GFI LanGuard Konsole * Stoppe alle GFI LanGuard Services: - Drücke Windows + R - Tippe services.msc und Enter - Stoppe alle Dienste, die mit GFI LanGuard beginnen * Öffne die Eingabeaufforderung als Administrator * Navigiere zum LanGuard-Installationsverzeichnis:    cd C:Program Files (x86)GFILanGuard 12 Agent     (Passe den Pfad an, falls deine Installation woanders liegt) * Registriere die DLL neu:    regsvr32 agentmanagercom.dll     * Starte alle GFI LanGuard Services wieder * Teste, ob die Agent-Scans jetzt zur konfigurierten Zeit starten LÖSUNG 2: FALLS DAS NICHT HILFT - AGENT NEU DEPLOYEN Wenn die DLL-Registrierung nicht hilft, könnte die Agent-Installation auf den Clients korrupt sein: * Wähle einen Testcomputer aus der OU * Deinstalliere den GFI LanGuard Agent auf diesem Computer * Starte den Computer neu * Starte den GFI LanGuard Attendant Service auf dem Server neu * Deploye den Agent neu auf diesen Computer * Teste, ob die Agent-Aktivitätseinstellungen jetzt funktionieren Kannst du zunächst die agentmanagercom.dll neu registrieren und mir Bescheid geben, ob das das Problem löst? Hier sind die relevanten KB-Artikel dazu: * Scheduled Scans and Patch Deployments Not Running [https://support.languard.gfi.com/article/122473] * Why are LanGuard Agents Scans Not Starting? [https://support.languard.gfi.com/article/123154] --- Customer (Jens Weber) --- Korrupt bei allen 17 Sekretariastcomputern? Hui. Eigentlich sollte das doch so ausgereift sein, da ja nichts neues mehr dazu kommt, das dies in zwei drei Stunden wieder läuft. --- AI Assistant --- Ich verstehe, dass das sehr frustrierend für dich ist. 😊 Ein Kollege aus unserem Support-Team kann dir bei diesem komplexeren Thema weiterhelfen – du kannst gerne eine der verfügbaren Optionen wählen, um den Kontakt herzustellen. --- Customer (Jens Weber) --- Button selection: [📩 Raise a ticket] --- AI Assistant --- Please provide any other additional details we might need to investigate and resolve your issue. 💡 If the reported behavior affects multiple end-customers, please do let us know the impact radius of the issue.
